pageTitle: Thursday's entries at Keeneland | The Courier-Journal | courier-journal.com
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {29660=Comments: CANTONIC had a four-race win streak snapped last out in a $250k race at Parx. He drops back in class for this one and appears to be in a good spot to pick up another win today. KRIS ROYAL comes off of a solid maiden win at Saratoga and has traind well here at Keeneland. BADLEROIBROWN has been idle since May but is in the capable hands of Graham Motion and has to be respected., 47811=Selections by Mike Battaglia Post Time 1:05 P.M. EDT1st - $18,000, Maiden Claiming ($30,000), 2 yo, F, 6 1/2 f. P# Horse, jockey/trainer Odds 1 Cebu, Cohen/McPeek 8-1 2 Spicy Devine,, 17529=Selections by Mike Battaglia Post Time 1:05 P.M. EDT, 26794=Comments: KATHY'S KITTEN was a beaten favorite last out at Belmont, but his only win came over the Keeneland poly back in April. He figures to be rallying from just off of the pace and can spring the mild upset. LIBERTY BOUND takes the big class drop and is the one to catch. TAPROOT fits with these., 67273=Copyright © 2015 archive.courier-journal.com. All rights reserved. Users of this site agree to the Terms of Service, Privacy Notice/Your California Privacy Rights, and Ad Choices, 34639=Comments: SHRILL ran well against much tougher company in back-to-back stakes. He has a definite class edge in this non winners of three. BALLYCLOUGH has been off since May but likes this track and figures to be tough despite the layoff. EVER SO LUCKY is a solid contender., 40384=Copyright 2012 EQUIBASE Company LLC. All Rights Reserved.}

textAfterTable: Selections: 1. Minnie Bear. 2. Bow to No One. 3. Cecileabration. Comments: MINNIE BEAR was beaten as the odds-on favorite last out at Monmouth but has been training well since coming to Kentucky. Give her the edge with Trujillo back aboard for Wesley Ward. BOW TO NO ONE showed improvement in her second career start and figures to be the one to beat. CECILEABRATION has only had one race and drops in class for this one. 2nd - $20,000, Maiden Claiming ($50,000), 3 yo's & up, F & M, 1 1/16 mi. P# Horse, jockey/trainer Odds 1 Hamsin, Mena/Clarkson 6-1 2 Kitty Tracks, Kelly/McCauley 20-1 3 Madoffwiththecash, Rocco/Reed 7-2 4 Gottahaveadream, Napravnik/Lopresti 3-1 5 Maggie the Cat, Spieth/Scott 15-1 6 Abitya, Johnson/Bell 8-1 7 Bell d'Amour, Castanon/Guida 20-1 8 Krista, Court/Oliver 4-1 9 Living My Dream, Leparoux/Maker 7-2 Selections: 1. Gottahaveadream. 2. Living My Dream. 3. Madoffwiththecash. Comments: GOTTAHAVEADREAM comes off of a runner-up effort at Presque Isle and appears to be in a good spot to get her maiden win with Napravnik picking up the mount for Charlie Lopresti. LIVING MY DREAM stopped badly in her last two but Maker and Leparoux have to be respected. MADOFFWITHTHECASH is a contender. 3rd - $15,000, Claiming ($7,500), 3 yo's & up, F & M, 1 1/8 mi. P# Horse,
